details.description: You must tell DVLA if you have hypoglycaemia
details.body:
You must tell DVLA if you have hypoglycaemia

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DIAB1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘DIAB1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 298KB)

You can find help and guidance on filling in the DIAB1 questionnaire in ‘A guide to filling in your DIAB1 medical form’.

Download ‘A guide to filling in your DIAB1 medical form’ (PDF, 414KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DIAB1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form. If you want to apply for a C1 or C1E entitlement download the ‘INS186’ leaflet.

Download ‘DIAB1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 315KB)

Download ‘A guide for drivers with insulin treated diseases who wish to apply for C1 or C1E entitlement’ (INS186) (PDF, 230KB)
